main event: Three crew members of the 'Lark Dog' weather mission observed an unusual cloud-like formation while flying at approximately 15,000 feet on 2 August 1949.
interesting points: The formation was composed of streaks that appeared to be clouds and was visible for about 15 minutes., The unusual formation was approximately 75 miles away from the observing aircraft., No unusual sounds were reported during the sighting., The pilots attempted to take photographs of the formation, although actual photographs were not included in the report., The investigation concluded that the formation could be attributed to a cloud or contrail, but no identifiable object was sighted.
witness description: crew members of the 'Lark Dog' weather mission, including the Aircraft Commander 1st Lt. Glenn D. Mill and others
